body.raw:
{
    "userId":"123",
    "jobTitle": "Specialist Programmer",
    "jobURL":"www.example.com",
    "companyName":"Infosys",
    "skills":[],
    "jobDescription":"Job Description- Power Programmers - Specialist Programmer,Infosys has designed the Power Programmers career track for polyglots who are passionate about programming and want to do more than programming as usual, who will be working on emergingand next-gen technologies. In this role, you will build platforms, marketplaces, innovative solutions, contribute and develop open software. will collaborate with some of the best talents inthe industry to create and implement innovative high quality programming solutions. You will be part of a learning culture, where teamwork and collaboration are encouraged, excellence is rewarded, and diversity is respected and valued. Technology Focus Areas - Frontier Engineering • Exponential Engineering [Greenfield, Brownfield, Platforms] • AI & Agentic Engineering [Cloud AI Platforms, Open Source, S4HANA, Salesforce] • Software Resiliency Engineering [Experts across Enterprise stack] • Forward Deployed Engineering [Services & Industry Stack] 1. Specialist Programmer – Level 1, you would • Develop full-stack applications using modern frameworks and best practices. • Apply AI in software engineering to enhance productivity and quality. • Work collaboratively with dynamic teams to build software applications using a predictable Agile DevSecOps model. • Leverage cloud platforms, DevOps, and AI tools throughout the development lifecycle. • Deliver innovation in chosen technologies, driving impactful solutions. • Contribute to open-source projects to build community engagement and technical Visibility. 2. Specialist Programmer – Level 2. In addition to Level 1, you would • Take on more complex challenges— develop scalable systems and solve advanced technical problems. • Provide technical guidance to team members and apply deep technology-specific knowledge to real-world projects. • Develop as an AI Master, contributing to the creation of Proof of Concepts (PoCs) and Minimum Viable Products (MVPs).• Drive innovation through open-source contributions, publishing white papers, and fostering a culture of experimentation. 3. Specialist Programmer – Level 3. In addition to Level 2, you would • Collaborate across teams to guide technical direction and lead experimentation with emerging technologies. • Develop as a Forward Deployed Engineer (FDE), working closely with clients and internal stakeholders. • Design and develop enterprise-grade platforms that scale across industries. • Play a key role in strategic technology initiatives, influencing architecture and innovation. • Contribute to AI/ML innovation, including building Small Language Models (SLMs) and advanced algorithms. • Engage actively in open-source communities, publish white papers, and drive patentable innovations. Additional Competencies • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to tackle complex technical challenges. • Effective collaboration and communication skills for cross-functional teamwork. • Demonstrated consistency in competitive coding platforms (e.g., HackerRank, CodeChef, LeetCode). • Possession of industry-recognized external certifications, where applicable. • Active participation in technology forums and contributions to open-sourcecommunities.",
    "industry":"Software",
    "minSalary": 675000,
    "maxSalary": 2100000,
    "locations":["Bengaluru"]
}

response.name: response

{
    "_id": "69310dcf3b010398359289a1",

    "course": "B.Tech CSE AIML",
    "skill": "Model Evaluation",
    "a_parameter": 0,
    "b_parameter": 5.8,
    "item": "What is the difference between precision and recall in classification metrics?",
    "options": [
        "No difference",
        "Precision = TP/(TP+FP), Recall = TP/(TP+FN)",
        "Precision = TP/(TP+FN), Recall = TP/(TP+FP)",
        "Both measure the same thing"
    ],
    "correct_answer": "Precision = TP/(TP+FP), Recall = TP/(TP+FN)",
    "justification": "Precision measures accuracy of positive predictions, while recall measures the ability to find all positive instances.",
    "image_needed": false,
    "svg_data": "",
    "itemType": "MCQ",
    "__v": 0
}
